place_1.name: Rohtang Pass
place_1.description: A high mountain pass on the eastern Pir Panjal Range of the Himalayas, known for its scenic beauty and adventure sports.

place_1.name: Jakhoo Hill
place_1.description: The highest point in Shimla, offering a panoramic view of the city and home to the ancient Jakhoo Temple.

place_1.name: Kangra Fort
place_1.description: One of the oldest forts in India, offering panoramic views of the surrounding valley.

place_2.name: Hadimba Devi Temple
place_2.description: An ancient cave temple dedicated to Hidimba Devi, surrounded by cedar forests and known for its unique pagoda-style architecture.

place_3.name: Solang Valley
place_3.description: A picturesque valley offering adventure sports like paragliding, zorbing, and skiing, surrounded by snow-capped peaks.

place_2.name: Vashisht Baths
place_2.description: Natural hot springs with separate bathing areas for men and women, believed to have healing properties.

place_3.name: Bijli Mahadev Temple
place_3.description: A sacred temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its tall staff that attracts lightning, offering panoramic views of the Kullu Valley.

place_2.name: Khajjiar Lake
place_2.description: Often referred to as 'Mini Switzerland of India', this lake is surrounded by meadows and forests.
